benchmark_details.name: HeTGB (Heterophilic Text-attributed Graph Benchmark)
benchmark_details.overview: HeTGB is a novel benchmark consisting of five real-world heterophilic graph datasets that incorporate rich textual descriptions. It facilitates systematic evaluation of Graph Neural Networks (GNNs), pre-trained language models (PLMs), and co-training methods specifically in the context of heterophilic text-attributed graphs.
benchmark_details.data_type: heterophilic graph datasets with text attributes

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a comprehensive evaluation framework for heterophilic text-attributed graphs, addressing limitations of existing datasets and aiding in the development of effective models.

data.source: Five real-world heterophilic graph datasets from diverse domains, enriched by extensive textual descriptions extracted from publicly available sources.
data.size: Five datasets with varying numbers of nodes and edges
data.annotation: Datasets constructed from original sources with raw textual content, preprocessed into a standardized format.

methodology.calculation: Metrics calculated based on node classification performance across the benchmark datasets.
methodology.interpretation: Accuracy reflects the proportion of correctly classified nodes in the node classification task.
methodology.baseline_results: Various baseline models tested include GCN, GraphSAGE, GAT, H2GCN, and PLM-based models.
methodology.validation: Datasets include standardized data splits for training, validation, and testing.
